aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The defining event of the flight was fuel exhaustion during enroute-cruise.
A collision occurred during takeoff/landing.
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot was 59 years old.
The pilot had Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot occupied the left seat.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot used a 3-point restraint.
The pilot had an Airplane instrument rating.
A second pilot was present during the flight.
The pilot had no instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 3 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on August 8, 2013.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on August 11, 2014.
The pilot had 929 total flight hours across all aircraft.
The pilot had 430 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot had 852 hours as Pilot In Command across all aircraft.
The pilot had 11 flight hours in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 4 flight hours in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 2 flight hours in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.
The flight instructor held an Airline transport and Flight instructor certificate.
The flight instructor was 56 years old.
The flight instructor had Single-engine land and Multi-engine land airplane ratings.
The flight instructor occupied the right seat.
The flight instructor had no other aircraft ratings.
The flight instructor used a 3-point restraint.
The flight instructor had an Airplane instrument rating.
The flight instructor had Airplane multi-engine and Airplane single-engine instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the flight instructor.
The flight instructor held a Class 3 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The flight instructor's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on May 31, 2013.
The flight instructor's occupational pilot status was unknown.
The flight instructor's last flight review or equivalent was on January 7, 2014.
The flight instructor had 2953 total flight hours across all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 599 total flight hours in this make and model.
The flight instructor had 2831 hours as Pilot In Command across all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 66 flight hours in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 22 flight hours in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 0 flight hours in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
Enroute-cruise | Fuel exhaustion (Defining event)
--- | ---
Landing | Collision during takeoff/land

## Pilot Information
Certificate: | Private
--- | ---
Age: | 59
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 3-point
Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 3 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | August 8, 2013
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | August 11, 2014
Flight Time: | 929 hours (Total, all aircraft), 430 hours (Total, this make and model), 852 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 11 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 4 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

## Flight Instructor Information
Certificate: | Airline transport; Flight instructor
--- | ---
Age: | 56
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Right
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 3-point
Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane multi-engine; Airplane single-engine
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 3 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | May 31, 2013
Occupational Pilot: | UNK
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | January 7, 2014
Flight Time: | 2953 hours (Total, all aircraft), 599 hours (Total, this make and model), 2831 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 66 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 22 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 0 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

---
